name: Key Lime Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled solo
reviews.text: first of all, one has to book a suite if one wants a tv or refridge in their rooms. who wants to go to the keys in the summer and have no refridge in the room? the people at the front desk are extremely rude and their attitude is, "what are you going to do, leave? you won't get a refund." too bad the previous owners of the chelsea sold out to these people.
reviews.title: no amenities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really like the Inn for the Cost. Stayed in our own little cottage that had a seperate patio. Pool was very clean and heated. Overall it was wonderful. Walked to Duval Street, Southern Most Point, and Mallory Square. Did have to rent scooter to go to Smathers Beach.
reviews.title: Good Place To Stay

likes.liked: — Close to the action....Duval Street, Mallory Square, and Southern Most Point
likes.disliked: — Did not have a bar or resturant, but plenty to walk too

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are on a budget and want to stay somewhere decent this is the place to go. I would definently stay again.
reviews.title: Tropical Paradise

likes.disliked: — Could have been closer to Mallory Square but not really an issue

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only thing I miss is having a resturant to go to on site, but there are plenty of places to go within walking distance. Duval Street is only about 5 blocks away.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay at Key Lime Inn!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very clean. Nice rooms with flat screen TVs. Tropical atmosphere. Continental breakfast outside by the pool. The staff was extremely nice. No problem with communication. Fairly close to Mallory Square. Loved it.
reviews.title: Disappointed with Key Lime

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008
reviews.text: This place is exactly what we go to Key West for. It's very charming and near enough to everything. The rooms are nothing special, but extremely clean! The staff is great, and they have free continental breakfast in this wonderful little courtyard area outside. It's just a great little place to stay!
reviews.title: What you go to Key West For!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 2 nights at the Key Lime Inn over President's Weekend and had a lovely stay! Our room directly faced the pool and breakfast area (served outdoors on the pool terrace), but we were never disturbed by other guests. The room itself was clean, large and felt recently renovated. Though not the most centrally located hotel, we could easily walk down to Duval St. and most locations in downtown Key West. The continental breakfast was fine, and the front desk staff very helpful in suggesting restaurants for dinner. We'll definitely consider staying here again!
reviews.title: Peaceful getaway

likes.disliked: — Proximity to a busy street (though only 2 rooms directly front the road).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008
reviews.text: The pros: great location, pretty decor, comfortable bed, nice linens, decent breakfast (included). And the roosters and chickens on the property added a fun "Key West touch" to the stay (but see the cons). On-site parking is free, but not guaranteed.
reviews.title: Pros and Cons

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The cons: a noisy, outdated air conditioner kept us awake at night. There was no alternative, as our "deluxe" room lacked a window, so we couldn't let in the breeze. Also, if you shut off the loud A/C, you're sure to hear the roosters crowing at 3 a.m. (so much for the "pro" above). We had double patio doors out to our private patio area, but there was no screen, so we couldn't leave the doors open all night (there are little critters, including the occasional scorpion, in Key West, folks). Also, only one-third of the patio was paved; the rest was full of dead leaves and stones (not very pretty). The bathroom fan was very noisy, and there was limited space for toiletries. Some of the staff were wonderful, a couple seemed very uncaring and distracted.
reviews.title: Delightful!

likes.liked: — Light airey decor of rooms and lovely pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, I'd say it's a pretty enough place to stay, but the cons don't justify the rate of almost $300 per night. To be fair, Key West is not inexpensive, but I would look elsewhere if I ever return to Key West.
reviews.title: We loved the Key Lime Inn!

likes.disliked: — Need another shower shelf for toiletries (shampoo etc.)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had booked the hotel for 2 nights in a queen size 'country room'. The room was in a single storey 'cabin' in the grounds. Country-style is one description for the room. Don't expect a glamourous room. Historic meaning old, definitely. Rustic comes to mind. The room was small, not much bigger than the bed and the bathroom minute, it seemed be be 'tacked on' to the end of the room. The location is good, within easy walking distance of Duval St. However, there was one major problem. Chickens and roosters. These wandered loose in the grounds. Have you ever been woken by a rooster standing outside your door at 2 in the morning? And then at 3, and 4? Some might think it entertaining or an adventure, but it was a real pain. The owners who live in the main house said that they never notice the noise. Having been kept awake all night we decided to move out and find somewhere quiet.
reviews.title: Rooster-roo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here in April 08. Were required to pay for our five nights accommodation when we checked in! The accommodations were just OK - clean but warn and dated. Won't stay there again; there are nicer places for the price.
reviews.title: Just OK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Key Lime Inn was relaxing, perfect for a getaway. It was clsoe enough to the action (few blocks to Duval), but not loud. The pool is the best part, large, plenty of room and shaded under a canopy of palms. I could have stayed there all day.
reviews.title: Relaxing stay & roosters too

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were smaller but similar to any beach hotel. Nice flat screen TV, toiletries were above average. They supplied beach towels. A/C worked well and was loud enough to drown out most of the crowing. Overall the Key Lime was quiet, roosters aside. They have a nice courtyard with swing. And there is free parking.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The continental breakfast was pleasant, that is all I need. Coffee may have been strong for vacation but that is OK. PLeny of places to walk to, and a CVS across the street for snacks.
reviews.title: The Worst Stay

likes.disliked: — The property is open to the street - the rooters drove me mad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I arrived in Key West without a hotel booking and saw the Key Lime Inn which looked really nice from the street. We checked in for 4 days but only stayed one of those.
reviews.title: Not impressed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were put in one of the outhouse buildings in the back of the property. These again were quite quaint looking and were next to the pool area. The pool area looked quite good and was a good size for the number of rooms with plenty of loungers. They sold cold drinks next to it aswell.
reviews.title: Fantastic Experience

likes.liked: — Private cottages outside the main building

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If was only two minutes walk to Duval street with its bars and restatuants and a big plus was that there was plenty of parking at the hotel. It was also within walking distance to the public beach and the southernmost point. The rooms themselves were also a good size with everything you'd expect in them
reviews.title: Quaint Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: On the flip side though the hotel was quite expensive compared to other hotels including the one we moved to the next day (The Pier house). It seemed expensive for the quality of the room aswell. Unfortunately our rooms was in one of the outhouses which seemed quite flimsy and more like a shed. Also, the property generally didn't seem that clean from the room to the dog mess on our doorstep which was nice welcome gift!
reviews.title: Okay for the budget.

likes.disliked: — Location far from the action on Duval Street

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Although this was a nice looking hotel at first glance it didn't live up to expectations unfortunately. If there'd been room in the main building then we'd have been alot happier but being given a room on of the out buildings seemed overpriced for the quality you'd expect.
reviews.title: GREAT Vacation!!

likes.liked: — The location and the onsite parking.
likes.disliked: — Didn't have any storage space in the bathroom for toiletries.

description: Key Lime Inn is a 37 room historic hotel in the center of Key West’s Old Town area, just two blocks from amazing Key West nightlife on the world famous Duval Street. You can walk to restaurants and nightlife and enjoy the quaint houses in Key West’s historic neighborhoods. Rooms are situated in several buildings spread out on an acre of grounds, giving the property a very tranquil, spacious feel. Garden paths and tropical foliage separate buildings and quiet resting spots. A large heated pool is surrounded by palm trees, and has plenty of deck space for comfortable chaise lounges.
